}}  Shows the various cultures of
Southeast Asian nation's.]] 'Southeast Asia' or 'Southeastern Asia' is a
subregion of Asia, consisting of the countries that are geographically south of
China, east of India, west of New Guinea and north of Australia. The region lies
on the intersection of geological plates, with heavy seismic and volcanic
activity. Southeast Asia consists of two geographic regions: Mainland Southeast
Asia, also known as Indochina, comprising Cambodia, Laos, Myanmar (Burma),
Thailand, Vietnam and Peninsular Malaysia, and Maritime Southeast Asia,
comprising Brunei, East Malaysia, East Timor, Indonesia, Philippines, Christmas
Island, and Singapore.

The major religions are Islam and Buddhism, followed by Christianity. However, a
wide variety of religions are found throughout the region, including many Hindu
and animist-influenced practices. [http://books.google.com/books?id=EJIBZqo-
30iYC&pg=PA150&lpg=PA150&dq=animism+%22south+east+asia%22&source=bl&ots=L769mZT-
xu5&sig=qRkJAbVLgFzUI46w8vqEMSKBQYA&hl=en&ei=tWDvTJjnDYiecZDD_MgK&sa=X&oi=book_-
result&ct=result&resnum=8&ved=0CEsQ6AEwBw#v=onepage&q=animism%20%22south%20east-
%20asia%22&f=false The modern anthropology of South ..]. .Google Books.
Retrieved on October 17, 2011.
